choices.D: Advertise summary routes of EIGRP to OSPF and deny specific EIGRP routes when redistributing into OSPF.
choices.B: Set a tag in the route map when redistributing EIGRP into OSPF on R1, and match the same tag on R2 to allow when redistributing OSPF into EIGRP.
choices.C: Apply a prefix list of EIGRP network routes in OSPF domain on R1 to propagate back into the EIGRP routing domain.
choices.A: Set a tag in the route map when redistributing EIGRP into OSPF on R1, and match the same tag on R2 to deny when redistributing OSPF into EIGRP.

discussion.content:
R1(config)#service sequence-numbers

R1(config)#service timestamps log datetime 

R1(config)#snmp-server enable traps ospf
I hope I get this one lol.

As the instructions say 'SNMP traps related to OSPF and participating interface state changes' I think you also need to include 'snmp trap link-status' under the OSPF interfaces. The OSPF state-change rerfers to neighbor state changes.

R-WEST(config)#service sequence-numbers
R-WEST(config)#service timestamps log datetime
R-WEST(config)#snmp-server enable traps ospf
R-WEST(config)#snmp-server enable traps ospf state-change

comments.content:
Correction: "snmp-server enable traps ospf state-change" is already included with the "snmp-server enable traps ospf" command. R-WEST(config)#snmp-server enable traps ospf
R-WEST(config)#do sh run | include snmp
snmp-server enable traps ospf state-change
snmp-server enable traps ospf errors
snmp-server enable traps ospf retransmit
snmp-server enable traps ospf lsa
snmp-server enable traps ospf cisco-specific state-change nssa-trans-change
snmp-server enable traps ospf cisco-specific state-change shamlink interface
snmp-server enable traps ospf cisco-specific state-change shamlink neighbor
snmp-server enable traps ospf cisco-specific errors
snmp-server enable traps ospf cisco-specific retransmit
snmp-server enable traps ospf cisco-specific lsa
snmp-server enable traps entity-sensor threshold

discussion.content: Dont forget "snmp-server enable traps ospf state-change" as it states interface changes.
There is another variation in the exam with this topology asking for configuring AAA to ensure that R-East can telnet to R-West.

SIMULATION

Guidelines

This is a lab item in which tasks will be performed on virtual devices.

• Refer to the Tasks tab to view the tasks for this lab item.
• Refer to the Topology tab to access the device console(s) and perform the tasks.
• Console access is available for all required devices by clicking the device icon or using the tab(s) above the console window.
• All necessary preconfigurations have been applied.
• Do not change the enable password or hostname for any device.
• Save your configurations to NVRAM before moving to the next item.
• Click Next at the bottom of the screen to submit this lab and move to the next question.
• When Next is clicked, the lab closes and cannot be reopened.


Topology
-

//IMG//



Tasks
-

Troubleshoot R-WEST to achieve the desired results:

1. The locally generated logs should have sequence numbers, date and time.
2. The SNMP traps related to OSPF and participating interface state changes utilizing RFC1253-MIB OSPFv2 should be sent to SNMP server.

//IMG//
Which two NLRI attributes are used by an MPLS Layer 3 VPN network to exchange VPNv4 routes between MPLS routers via MP-BGP? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
VPNv4 Prefix = RD + IPv4 Prefix
Extended-Community = RT

Selected Answer: AC
VPNv4 Prefix (A): This is a combination of the customer’s IPv4 prefix and an 8-byte Route Distinguisher (RD), which makes the prefix globally unique across different VPNs.

Extended-Community (C): This includes attributes such as Route Target (RT) and other community values that control how VPNv4 routes are imported and exported across different VRFs (Virtual Routing and Forwarding instances) on the MPLS routers.

comments.content: VPNV4 prefix is not an attribute, SPN label is an attribute.

discussion.content:

B & D are correct

B and D are correct

RD (Route Distinguisher)
IPv4 prefix(with prefix length)
Next Hop
VPN Label

extended community:
route target

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.

//IMG//


The remote branch locations have a static neighbor relationship configured to R1 only. R1 has successful neighbor relationships with the remote locations of R2 and R3, but the end users cannot communicate with each other.

Which configuration resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
split-horizon is default behavior for EIGRP, so it will not show up in the configuration. it stops the spokes from having routes to each other, so we need to disable it.

comments.content: Not necessarily DMVPN "spoke" question either, this could be simply the hub conencted to a switch, branches conencted to switch (i.e.. a service provider) and split-horizon is a problem either way

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is corerct
